repnme.cdata!:
Mexico -Strengthening the contribution of
            education in the knowledge economy

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about
            strengthening the contribution of education in the knowledge
            economy in Mexico. Education quality was a major concern at
            all levels and most students did not meet minimum standards.
            World Bank has supported most areas of the education sector,
            with a strong focus on early childhood development and rural
            education. One important area in the National Education
            Strategy was promoting greater community participation in
            schools with focus on disadvantaged schools. The Bank was
            also supporting efforts to improve inclusion through better
            targeting of scholarships and an increased focus on
            indigenous and disabled students. The federal government has
            played a leading role in identifying interventions and
            supervising the activities of each agency. Mexico also has a
            wide range of civil society and philanthropic organizations
            in the education sector. Mexico has achieved universal
            primary education and gender equality, meeting the education
            related Millennium Development Goals as well as focusing on
            improving quality and relevance.

            the contribution of education in the knowledge economy

abstracts.cdata!:
The past decade in Albania has been
            characterized by very rapid economic growth and substantial
            improvements in the welfare of the population. Once labeled
            as the continent's poorest country, Albania has enjoyed
            annual real economic growth rates of around 6 percent over
            the last decade, enabling it to graduate from the
            Bank's concessional lending arm (the International
            Development Association or IDA) and to join the ranks of the
            world's upper-middle income countries. In July 2010,
            Albania's gross domestic product (GDP) per capita stood
            at United States (U.S.) $3,836, well above the IDA
            threshold. The last decade also saw important gains in the
            populations welfare evidenced by falling poverty rates and
            substantially improved millennium development goal (MDG)
            indicators. The Albanian economy has proven quite resilient
            in the face of domestic and exogenous shocks - for example,
            it was only one of two countries in Europe to achieve
            positive (albeit reduced) growth in the wake of the
            2008-2009 global financial and economic crisis.

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the School-Based Management
            Project for Mexico were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the
            Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: this was a central observation made during
            the program's design, based on the international
            literature. However, some elements of PEC (Quality Schools
            Program - Programa Escuelas de Calidad) were still top-down
            and did not work well. PEC has a transparent formula that
            allocates resources across states on a per capita basis
            using the total number of children between the ages of four
            and fourteen. The studies found that in many cases community
            participation existed in paper but not in reality. Real
            community participation requires cultural changes,
            incentives, and capacity building. Phase two will support
            enhanced capacity building for school directors and
            community groups and will more actively promote greater
            social participation. Government commitment to the
            implementation of a project or program is perhaps the best
            indicator of its overall success. An Adaptable Program Loan
            (APL) is a useful instrument to support implementation of a
            Government program where a long-term involvement may be
            necessary to produce expected outcomes. When designing
            projects and corresponding Bank loans with both relatively
            fast disbursing components and slower technical assistance
            type activities, it is desirable to build in mechanisms that
            pace the disbursements of fast disbursing components to
            progress in the implementation of technical assistance for
            institutional strengthening type activities. Care is needed
            in the design of a project's monitoring framework and
            indicators to avoid individual indicators that are not
            feasible given the changes brought about by the project.

abstracts.cdata!:
The long-term development objective of
            the Mexico School-Based Management Project is to improve the
            quality of education as measured by coverage, social
            participation, and educational outcomes. The project has
            three components: Component 1, school grants; Component 2,
            monitoring and program oversight; and Component 3, policy
            development and evaluation.
